IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM
PRESENT
THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE K.ABRAHAM MATHEW
FRIDAY, THE 04TH DAY OF JANUARY 2019 / 14TH POUSHA, 1940
Cr1.MC.No. 40 of 2019
CRIME NO. 1106/2018 OF PARIPPALLY POLICE STATION, KOLLAM
PETITIONER/S:
BATJU
AGED 45 YEARS
S/O.SIVADASAN, KUZHUVILLA VEEDU, PARIPPALLY
KOLLAM .
BY ADV. SRI.M.R.SARIN
RESPONDENT/S:
1 THE STATE OF KERALA
REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH
COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM-682031.
2 HAREESH
AGED 27 YEARS
S/O.BABU, KUNNUVILLA PUTHENVEEDU KULMADA
PARTPPALLY KOLLAM-691001.
BY ADV. SRI.V.VINAR
OTHER PRESENT:
SRI.C.S.HRITHWIK SR PP
THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON
04.01.2019, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE
FOLLOWING:

oo
2019/KER/218

Crl.MC.No. 40 of 2019

1i2..
ORDER
Petition filed under Section 482 Cr.P.C.

2. The petitioner is the accused in Crime No.
1106 of 2018 of Parippally Police Station
registered for the offences under Sections
323, 324, 341 & 447 of the Indian Penal Code.
The second respondent is the victim. It is
submitted that the matter has been settled and
the proceedings in the criminal case may be
quashed.

3. Heard the learned counsel for the petitioner
and the second respondent and the learned
Public Prosecutor.

4. I have perused the affidavit filed by the
second respondent, who has entered appearance
through counsel. I am satisfied that the
allegation of settlement is true and no public
interest is involved. There is no impediment
for granting the prayer of the petitioner.

oe
BIER
2019/KER/218
Crl.MC.No. 40 of 2019
1.3..
In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed. The
proceedings in Crime No. 1106 of 2018 of
Parippally Police Station are quashed. The
learned magistrate may pass appropriate orders
for the disposal of the material objects, if
any, produced in the case.
Sd/-
K.ABRAHAM MATHEW
JUDGE
APPENDIX
PETITIONER'S/S EXHIBITS:
ANNEXURE Al THE TRUE COPY OF THE FIR IN CRIME
NO.1106/18 OF PARIPPALLY POLICE
STATION PENDING BEFORE JUDICIAL FIRST
CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT (TEMPORARY)
PARAVOOR.
ANNEXURE A2 AFFIDAVIT SINGED BY THE 2ND
RESPONDENT.
Bka/07.01.2019
